climbs.name: Where's The Beef
climbs.fa: Brad Johnson, John Robinson, Kevin Barcza

content.description: This climb starts below the Secret Sauce Ledge and has a reachy crux just before you exit onto the Secret Sauce Ledge. The next crux is above the Secret Sauce Ledge and is interesting jams under an overhang. The next crux has some great stemming.
content.protection: 12 bolts with two Mussy hooks at the top.
content.location:
Starts on the ground (not on the Secret Sauce Ledge) and between "

Big Gulp

" (which is on the Secret Sauce Ledge) and "

Too Much Good Stuff

" (which is also on the ground).

content.description: Second move crux followed by several moves to the Secret Sauce ledge.  Once off the ledge the climbing is continuous, tricky and hard.  The true crux is the final couple of moves to the anchor.  Look for rests after leaving the upper ledge.
content.location: Twice Cooked Whopper is the second route on the right side of the obvious arete.  From the ground you will need to 3rd class up approximately 12 feet to the Secret Sauce ledge. Refer to the guide on the main Emeralds Page. (Photos)

content.description: This is a cave/overhanging problem. There are no bolts on the climb but there are top anchors which can be accessed by climbing "The Culmination of my Life's Work"
content.location: Far left on the Lower Fast Food Wall. goes out the cave

content.description: Climb starts on the right side of the arete.  Move up past two bolts to left side of arete.  The crux is from the second to fourth bolts.  Just getting on and moving off the ramp above the second bolt is "interesting". If it seems awkward try a different way.
content.protection: 11 bolts plus mussey hooks at the top.
content.location: Climb is the last climb on the right side of Fast Food Wall on the obvious arete. Easiest approach is to continue up the trail past the base of Kudos cliff left.

content.description: Fun route with a crux at the third bolt.
content.protection: All bolts with mussey hooks at the anchor.
content.location: This route is right of "In & Out Urge" and Left of "Fries with that Mantel". It is on the Upper Fast Food Wall. Refer to the guide on the main Emeralds page (Photos)

content.description: Crux three moves up.  If the middle of the climb seems awkward you're doing it wrong.
content.location: From the ground you will need to 3rd class up to the Secret Sauce ledge and this will be the 3rd route right from the arete. It is between Twice Cooked Whopper and All Beef Patty. Refer to the main Emeralds page. (Photos)

climbs.name: In And Out Urge
climbs.fa: Brad Johnson, James Markovsky, John Robinson

content.protection: All bolts with mussey hooks at the anchor.
content.location: This route is the furthest route left on the Upper Fast Food Wall. At the top, follow the bolt line, don't cheat and go right to the Arete. Refer to the guide on the main Emeralds page (Photos)

content.description: Easy climbing to high first bolt.  Moderate climbing to the "easy" mantle then a couple of hard moves to a technical top out.
content.protection: Bolted with a high first bolt.  Mussey hooks at the anchor.
content.location: Route is on obvious arete on the right side of the large chimney in the middle of Fast Food Wall. This route is left of Twice Cooked Whopper and right of Super Size me. It is on the Upper Fast Food Wall. Refer to the guide on the main Emeralds page (Photos)

content.description:
Start in the cave, left of The Culmination of My Life's Work; 3 bolts lead you to a shared bolt with the aforementioned route.

This is perhaps a more interesting start to the crux of Culmination if you're comfortable at the grade. The crux is getting from the ground to the jug below the second bolt... you can start very low and add an additional contrived, but challenging, move or two.

Or, if you're uncomfortable at the grade, lead Culmination and TR.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchors. Because of the low crux, a stick clip might be nice.
content.location: Start in the cave, currently the leftmost bolt line on the lower Fast Food wall.

climbs.name: The Culmination Of My Life's Work

content.description: Pick your path up a lightly featured face, negotiation a small but burly roof, then balance up a slab to the anchors. Short but bouldery and satisfying.
content.protection: 4 or so bolts, to a bolted anchor with chains.
content.location: Lower Fast Food Wall, just right of the cave formed by the large roof. Refer to main Emeralds page. (photos)

content.description: 5.10 climbing to 11c/d crux.  Tricky moves to top.
content.protection: 5 bolts with a little spice and a single belay bolt at the bottom of the climb. Two Mussy hooks at the top of the climb.
content.location: The route is on the far right of Upper Fast Food Wall.  Class four (below "Fries with that Mantel") to the Secret Sauce ledge, walk to the right side of the wall  and clip into the single belay bolt. Refer to the main Emeralds page. (Photos)
Right of please pull forward. 4th route on the ledge.
